title: London Fletcher sounds off on Redskins decision to have Adrian Peterson inactive
text:
Early Sunday morning, reports came out that Redskins running back Adrian Peterson would be a healthy scratch for the Redskins Week 1 contest against the Eagles. That was confirmed once the Redskins released their inactive list 90 minutes prior to kickoff.

Former Redskins linebacker and captain London Fletcher was not happy about the decision, and he apparently wasn't the only one. Fletcher reported on CBS Sports this morning that some of the veteran's in Washington's locker room were unhappy with the decision to have Peterson inactive.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

"It makes no sense to me to not have Adrian Peterson up for this game, a guy who ran over 1000 yards for your football team last year, a guy who brings physicality and brings the toughness."@LFletcher59 gives his take on Adrian Peterson being inactive against the Eagles. #TOPS pic.twitter.com/w3cUCw4KQI — CBS Sports Network (@CBSSportsNet) September 8, 2019

"They're not happy about this. Not everyone is on board with Adrian Peterson not playing," Fletcher said on the Redskins veterans.

Fletcher questioned the move, wondering why the Redskins are going to rely on a running back who has yet to play a regular-season NFL game and coming off a devasting knee injury.

"When you think about going into Philly, going against a defense like the Eagles, the Redskins are going to need to run the football," Fletcher said. "They're going to rely heavily on Derrius Guice, a guy coming off an ACL injury."

Story continues

Fletcher also emphasized that he simply didn't understand why Peterson was inactive based on the 34-year-olds performance for the Burgundy and Gold a season ago.

"It makes no sense to me not to have Adrian Peterson up for this game," Fletcher said. "[He's] a guy who ran for over 1,000 yards for your football team last year, a guy who brings physicality and brings the toughness."

The Redskins will roll with Guice, Chris Thompson, and Wendell Smallwood as their running backs against Philadelphia.

"I just don't get why you would have Adrian Peterson inactive," he continued.
